```{{ request.postDict.inpageEditorUI }}```
returns true if user is in the editor. returns undefined if user is not in the editor.
Note this means it will return undefined in preview URLs.

for context: I’m building an “generate_error” macro that injects CSS to target a psuedo element with the error message in the editor only and being able to only inject the css when in the editor is exactly what I need :smile:

We’re currently working on a way for developers to configure the options available in rich text toolbars. Would you prefer to set those options be specifying what you want to _take away_ from the toolbar or would you prefer to specify the things you _want to show_ in the toolbar?
